desc.components: You can select items to be placed on the comprehensive analysis screen.
desc.frontComponents: You can view the items placed on the dashboard.
desc.basicInformation: You can set the availability of items placed at the top of the comprehensive analysis screen under [Basic Information].
desc.aliasManagement: You can set the items placed in Favorites at the bottom right of the monitoring app's web view, native page management, and comprehensive analysis screen.
desc.aliasManagementSub: We recommend that you select page items that your users use frequently.
desc.logDescription: We define logs for each type collected by MAXY.
desc.initialpassword: Reset PW is [the first three digits of your ID + the current month and day (MMdd) + !@].
desc.userFlowStatistics: You can check aggregate information about user behavior for monitored apps.
desc.userFlowList: You can view the user list of the monitored app.
desc.deviceList: You can view the status of all devices registered.
desc.monitoring: This feature only displays logs that occurred on the registered page of the selected device. It works when you search by Device ID in Log Analysis > Real-time Log Search.
desc.notification: You can check received notifications from MAXY mobile app monitoring.
desc.notificationSetting: You can set up notifications for MAXY mobile app monitoring.
desc.obfuscation: Manage obfuscation rule files by app build version.
desc.aibot: This is a list of data analyzed by MAXY AI. Data is stored for up to 7 days.
desc.sessionReplayBlock1: A function that blocks areas that should not be monitored by Session Replay.
desc.sessionReplayBlock2: By registering monitoring exclusion elements for each app, you can exclude both the DOM and contents of the area from session recording.
desc.sessionReplayBlock3: Blocking rules can be applied by adding the ID or class of the UI containing sensitive information.

desc.logmeter: Visually represents the form in which real-time log data is received.
desc.responsetimescatter: Monitors Response Time with device-specific data.
desc.loadingtimescatter: Monitors Loading Time with device-specific data.
desc.pvequalizer: Monitors each page view of the monitoring app.
desc.devicedistribution: Monitors Error and Crash of devices by operating system with high frequency of use.
desc.accessibility: Monitors user accessibility of the monitoring app.
desc.resourceusage: Monitors resource usage of devices with high frequency of use.
desc.favorites: Monitors performance for each major page specified by the administrator.
desc.pageview: Monitors Error and Crash for each page of the monitoring app.
desc.responsetimeline: Response time is controlled in real time based on Logmeter.
desc.loadingtimeline: Loading time is controlled in real time based on Logmeter.
desc.areadistribution: Analyze app performance distribution by region based on today statistics.
desc.versioncomparison: Compare and analyze key monitoring items for each OS version based on previous day statistics.
desc.crashesbyversion: The part where the crash occurred is useful.
desc.versionconversion: Displays usage rates by OS and app version.
desc.marketinginsight: Analyze user behavior patterns by setting a start URL and a destination URL.
desc.frontpageloading: Analyzes page performance over the last 5 minutes.
desc.frontresponsetime: Analyzes Ajax performance over the last 5 minutes.
desc.fronterror: Visualizes the error count from the last 5 minutes.
desc.frontregionalanalysis: Analyzes regional app performance distribution based on today’s statistics.
desc.frontpagerequested: Visualizes the page count from the last 5 minutes.
desc.frontajaxresponse: Visualizes the Ajax count from the last 5 minutes.
desc.frontlivesessionview: Visualizes current connection session in real time.

tip.logmeter: Tip: Indicates the weight of a single block displayed in the container.
tip.responsetimescatter: Tip: Time can be set within a maximum of $1ms and a minimum of $2ms.
tip.loadingtimescatter: Tip: Time can be set within a maximum of $1ms and a minimum of $2ms.
tip.pvequalizer: Tip: The maximum number of page views that can be displayed is $1.
tip.favorites: Tip: The maximum number of pages that can be displayed is $1.
tip.pageview: Tip: The maximum number of page views that can be displayed is $1.
tip.marketinginsight: Tip: For accurate analysis, the Start and Reach URLs should be the page where the user flows are linked.

prefix.responsetimescatter: Sets the baseline for usability degradation intervals.
prefix.loadingtimescatter: Sets the baseline for usability degradation intervals.
prefix.pvequalizer: Number of page views to analyze
prefix.pageview: Number of page views to analyze

desc.logmeter: Visually represents the form in which real-time log data is received.
desc.responsetimescatter: Monitors Response Time data by device.
desc.loadingtimescatter: Monitors Loading Time data by device.
desc.pvequalizer: Monitors each page view of the monitoring app.
desc.devicedistribution: Monitors Errors and Crashes by frequently used device operating systems.
desc.accessibility: Monitors the user accessibility of the monitoring app.
desc.resourceusage: Monitors resource usage on frequently used devices.
desc.favorites: Monitors the performance of key pages specified by the admin.
desc.pageview: Monitors Errors and Crashes on each page of the monitoring app.
desc.responsetimeline: Real-time monitoring of Response Time based on Logmeter.
desc.loadingtimeline: Real-time monitoring of Loading Time based on Logmeter.
desc.areadistribution: Analyzes app performance distribution by region based on today’s statistics.
desc.versioncomparison: Compares and analyzes key monitoring items by OS version.

msg.requiredInput: This is a required input value.
msg.comparison.select: Please select the target for comparative analysis.

bi.install: Number of installations of monitoring apps and ratio compared to previous day
bi.ccu: Number of users using the monitoring app per minute
bi.mau: Number of users using the monitoring app per month and percentage compared to previous day
bi.dau: Number of users using the monitoring app per day and ratio compared to the previous day
bi.pv: Number of pages of monitoring app viewed by users and ratio compared to previous day
bi.revisit: Number of users who reuse the monitoring app (Retention Rate) and percentage compared to the previous day
bi.sleep: Number of users who do not use the monitoring app after installation and ratio compared to the previous day
bi.login: Number of logins today by users who installed the monitoring app and ratio compared to the previous day
bi.stay: Average time spent on monitoring app users and percentage compared to previous day
bi.log: Number of data logs collected for analysis by monitoring app and ratio compared to previous day
bi.error: Number of errors collected for analysis by monitoring app and ratio compared to previous day
bi.crash: Number of crashes collected for analysis of monitor apps and ratio compared to previous day

alias.title: You can set the items placed in Favorites at the bottom right of the monitoring app's web view, native page management, and comprehensive analysis screen.
alias.subTitle: We recommend that you select page items that your users use frequently.
alias.subTitle2: The new page will take effect the next day.

pageParameter.info: Controls the strings to include/exclude from the request URL.

noset.info: Here is a list of unspecified URLs that were collected through monitoring today and that users are accessing.

webserver.start: Start execution of the local webserver of the monitored device
webserver.error: An error occurred during operation of the local webserver of the monitored device.
webserver.end: Complete execution of Local Webserver of the monitored device

webNavigation.error: An error occurred when loading the mobile web page.
webNavigation.scriptError: Mobile web page Javascript error occurred
webNavigation.resourceDownStart: Start downloading resources for mobile web pages
webNavigation.resourceDownEnd: Finish downloading resources for mobile web page
webNavigation.ssl: Mobile web pages communicate with SSL
webNavigation.click: Click(Point Up) event in mobile web page
webNavigation.pageLoad: Mobile Web Page Lifecycle Load Event
webNavigation.pageBack: Go back during mobile web page Lifecycle PageShow event
webNavigation.pageRefresh: Refresh during mobile web page Lifecycle PageShow event
webNavigation.pageForward: Mobile Web Page Lifecycle PageShow Event
webNavigation.pageHide: Mobile Web Page Lifecycle PageHide Event
webNavigation.pagePushState: PushState event of mobile web page History object
webNavigation.pagePopState: Mobile web page back event occurs
webNavigation.pageUnload: Mobile web page Lifecycle Unload event called when leaving the page
webNavigation.pageHashChange: Only the hash (#) is changed on the target mobile web page
webNavigation.pageReadyStateChange: Mobile Web Page Lifecycle ReadyStateChange Event
webNavigation.pageDOMContentLoaded: Mobile Web Page Lifecycle DOMContentLoaded Event
webNavigation.loadingTime: The time it takes for a mobile web page to become ready to work.
webNavigation.login: Check whether the monitoring target is logged in or not
webNavigation.logout: Check whether the monitoring target logs out
webNavigation.bizError: Mobile web page customer Business error occurred
webNavigation.webVital: Mobile web page Web Vital Log collected
webNavigation.popupInfo: Collect popup information when a popup is called
webNavigation.termsComplete: Collection of information on completion of agreement to terms and conditions
webNavigation.bottomPopupInfo: Collecting information about the called popup when a bottom popup is called.

resourceDown.inf: Download INF file for Resource Download of MiAPS Hybrid
resourceDown.start: Start Resource Download of MiAPS Hybrid
resourceDown.end: Complete Resource Download of MiAPS Hybrid
resourceDown.error: An error occurred during Resource Download of MiAPS Hybrid.

httpRequest.request: Initiates an Http request between Client¹ and Server
httpRequest.response(Legacy): Responds to Http requests between Client¹ and Server
httpRequest.response: Responds to Http requests between Client¹ and Server
httpRequest.error: Error occurred during Http request between Client¹ and Server
httpRequest.exception: Exception occurred during Http request between Client¹ and Server

nativeAction.start: A request from the native area of the monitoring target is initiated.
nativeAction.end: Request terminated in native area of monitoring target
nativeAction.error: An error occurs in the native area of the monitoring target.
nativeAction.appForeground: Monitoring target changed from Background to Foreground
nativeAction.appBackground: Monitoring target changed from Foreground to Background
nativeAction.actionClick: Tagging when a Click Event that requires collection occurs in the Native app
nativeAction.installReferer: Native app Install referer collection log

native.crash: A crash occurred in the native area.

customTag.common: Defines general indicators excluding errors automatically collected from monitoring targets.
customTag.error: Define separate issues excluding errors automatically collected from monitoring targets.
customTag.alarm: Defines separate notification items excluding errors automatically collected from monitoring targets.

ajax.error: XMLHttpRequest (Ajax) response status code is 3xx, 4xx or 5xx
ajax.exception: An exception occurred during XMLHttpRequest (Ajax) transmission

user.name: User Name
user.initialpassword: Reset PW is [the first three digits of your ID + the current month and day (MMdd) + !@].

msg.userId: User ID is a required field.

msg.permissionEmpty: Please enter a value for permission distinction.

msg.accountReset: Would you like to reset your account?

msg.nogroup: Please create a group first in group management.

msg.targetIdEmpty: You are not registered as a monitoring target. You can modify it after registration.

title.install: App installation rate compared to previous day (%)
title.login: Login rate compared to previous day (%)
title.dau: DAU ratio compared to previous day (%)
title.pv: PV ratio compared to previous day (%)
title.errorPct: Error rate compared to the previous day (%)
title.crashPct: Crash rate compared to the previous day (%)

msg.minmaxall: Please enter a minimum of 10 and a maximum of 100
msg.minmaxcrashalim: Please enter a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 100
msg.minmaxperformance: Please enter a minimum of 500 and a maximum of 3000
msg.statusread: Would you like to change the status to 'Read'?
msg.changestatus: The status has been changed to ‘read’.
msg.alertPeriodMax: If repeated more than 10 times per day, it may cause increased load on the server and network communication.
msg.limitValueRequired: The maximum threshold is a required field.
msg.alarmMsgRequired: The Alarm Msg is a required field.

tip.error: Please enter a minimum of 10 and a maximum of 100.
tip.crash: Please enter a minimum of 1 and a maximum of 100.
tip.pct: Please enter a minimum of 10% and a maximum of 100%.
tip.memory: Please enter a minimum of 10mb and a maximum of 100mb.
tip.comSensitivity: Please select between Bad and Too Bad.
tip.time: Please input within a minimum of 500ms and a maximum of 3,000ms.

ex.error: Example) The error that occurred on the login page exceeded the threshold.
ex.crash: Example) The crash that occurred on the login page exceeded the threshold.
ex.cpu: Example) CPU usage of iPhone XS exceeds 70%.
ex.memory: Example) The memory usage of iPhone XS exceeds 100mb.
ex.comSensitivity: Example) The network sensitivity of Galaxy S23 was calculated as Too Bad.
ex.loadingTime: Example) The loading time of the login screen exceeded the threshold.
ex.responseTime: Example) The response time on the login screen exceeded the threshold.
ex.install: Example) The app installation rate compared to the previous day exceeded 100%.
ex.login: Example) The login rate compared to the previous day exceeded 100%.
ex.dau: Example) The DAU ratio compared to the previous day exceeded 100%.
ex.pv: Example) The PV ratio compared to the previous day exceeded 100%.
ex.errorRatio: Example) The error occurrence rate compared to the previous day exceeded 100%.
ex.crashRatio: Example) The crash occurrence rate compared to the previous day exceeded 100%.

popup.title: MAXY AI Bot Settings

title.desc: Manage DSYM files by app build version. (Please upload the DSYM file to get a more detailed StackTrace in case of a crash.)

text.dropZoneDesc1: When uploading DSYM compressed file, AppVer, AppBuildNum, and UUID are extracted and automatically registered.
text.dropZoneDesc2: Only compressed files can be uploaded. (Support formats: ZIP, GZ, GZIP)
text.dropZoneDesc3: File size must be {size} or less.
text.validFile: Please upload the compressed DSYM file.
text.validDsym: If the DSYM file is not uploaded, that version of the symbolization function is not available.
